item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Mother Jones
item.description: "Pray for the dead and fight like hell for the living." -- Mother Jones

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "If there is no struggle, there is no progress. Those who profess to favor freedom, and yet depreciate agitation, are men who want crops without plowing up the ground. They want rain without thunder and lightning. They want the ocean without the awful roar of its many waters. This struggle may be a moral one; or it may be a physical one; or it may be both moral and physical; but it must be a struggle." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "Let me tell you what I think of bicycling. I think it has done more to emancipate women than anything else in the world. It gives women a feeling of freedom and self-reliance. I stand and rejoice every time I see a woman ride by on a wheelâ€¦the picture of free, untrammeled womanhood." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "There never will be complete equality until women themselves help to make laws and elect lawmakers." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Ida B. Wells
item.description: "one had better die fighting against injustice than to die like a dog or a rat in a trap" -- Ida B. Wells

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary Cathryn add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "By the time you swear you're his, Shivering and sighing. And he vows his passion is, Infinite, undying. Lady make note of this -- One of you is lying." -- Dorothy Parker
